apis.description: Query for the list of available public systems

operations.notes: All systems you own, public systems, and systems that have been shared with you.

parameters.description: The type of system to return
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: Should only default systems be returned
parameters.name: default

parameters.description: Should only publicly available systems be returned
parameters.name: public

parameters.description: The max number of results.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The number of records to when returning the results. When paginating results, the page number = ceil(offset/limit)
parameters.name: offset

operations.summary: Show all systems available to the user.

parameters.defaultValue:
{
	"id": "demo.execute.example.com",
	"name": "Demo SGE + GSISSH demo vm",
	"status": "UP",
	"type": "EXECUTION",
	"description": "My example system using gsissh and gridftp to submit jobs used for testing.",

				"protocol": "MYPROXY"

	},

		"port": 2811,
		"protocol": "GRIDFTP",
		"rootDir": "/home/demo",
		"homeDir": "/",
		"auth": {
			"username": "demo",
			"password": "demo",
			"credential": "",
			"type": "X509",
			"server": {
				"id": "myproxy.teragrid.org",
				"name": "XSEDE MyProxy Server",
				"site": "ncsa.uiuc.edu",
				"endpoint": "myproxy.teragrid.org",
				"port": 7512,

	},
	"maxSystemJobs": 100,
	"maxSystemJobsPerUser": 10,
	"scheduler": "SGE",
	"environment": "",
	"startupScript": "./bashrc"
}

parameters.description: The description of the system to update.
parameters.name: body

operations.summary: Find information about an individual system.

operations.notes: PUBLISH moves the system from private to public. Only API administrators can peform this action. DEFAULT makes the given system your default system of that type. When no system is explicitly specified in URI, your default storage system will be used. CLONE creates a private copy of the named system. Authentication information will not be cloned, so you must update the system with your own credentials.

parameters.description: The unique id of the system
parameters.name: systemId

parameters.description: The description of the system to update.
parameters.name: body

operations.summary: Perform a management action on the system.

operations.notes: Disables the system and all applications registered to it. Once deleted, the system cannot be recovered and the systemId cannot be reused.

parameters.description: The unique id of the system
parameters.name: systemId

operations.summary: Delete a system.

apis.description: List all user roles on this system

operations.notes: Users must have ADMIN role or greater on a system to view its roles.

parameters.description: The id of the system.
parameters.name: systemId

parameters.description: The max number of results.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The number of records to when returning the results. When paginating results, the page number = ceil(offset/limit)
parameters.name: offset

operations.summary: Get a list of all users and their roles on this system.

operations.notes: Setting a user's role to NONE or an empty string is the same as deleting that user's permission. Once all user's roles have been removed from a system, any applications that were registered by the user on the system will be disabled. Users must have ADMIN role or greater on a system to manage its roles.

parameters.description: The id of the system.
parameters.name: systemId

parameters.description: The role to update.
parameters.name: body

operations.summary: Add or update a user's role on a system.

operations.notes: This will reset the permissions such that only the user who registered the system will be able to view it. System owners cannot remove their own permissions. All apps registered by the deleted users on this system will be disabled. Users must have ADMIN role or greater on a system to delete its roles.

parameters.description: The id of the system.
parameters.name: systemId

operations.summary: Deletes all roles on a system.

apis.description: List all user roles on this system

operations.notes: Users must have ADMIN role or greater on a system to view its roles.

parameters.description: The id of the system.
parameters.name: systemId

parameters.description: The username of the user about whose role you are inquiring.
parameters.name: username

parameters.description: The max number of results.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The number of records to when returning the results. When paginating results, the page number = ceil(offset/limit)
parameters.name: offset

operations.summary: Get a specific user's roles on this system.

operations.notes: Setting a user's role to NONE or an empty string is the same as deleting that user's permission. Once all user's roles have been removed from a system, any applications that were registered by the user on the system will be disabled. Users must have ADMIN role or greater on a system to edit its roles.

parameters.description: The id of the system.
parameters.name: systemId

parameters.description: The username of the api user associated with the role
parameters.name: username

parameters.description: The role to update.
parameters.name: body

operations.summary: Add or update a user's role on a system.

operations.notes: This will reset the permissions such that only the user who registered the system will be able to view it. System owners cannot remove their own permissions. All apps registered by the deleted users on this system will be disabled. Users must have ADMIN role or greater on a system to delete its roles.

parameters.description: The id of the system.
parameters.name: systemId

parameters.description: The username of the api user associated with the role
parameters.name: username

operations.summary: Deletes all roles on a system.

apis.description: List of internal user credentials on this system

operations.notes: Users must have ADMIN role or greater on a system to view its credentials. No sensitive information will be returned. This is strictly to keep track of which internal users have their own credentials.

parameters.description: The id of the system.
parameters.name: systemId

parameters.description: The max number of results.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The number of records to when returning the results. When paginating results, the page number = ceil(offset/limit)
parameters.name: offset

operations.summary: Get a list of all internal users and their credentials on this system.

operations.notes: Credentials will be valided when submitted. If the credentials are not valid, an error will be returned. Users must have ADMIN role or greater on a system to manage its credentials. No sensitive information will be returned. This is strictly to keep track of which internal users have their own credentials.

parameters.description: The id of the system.
parameters.name: systemId

parameters.description: The description of the internal user credential to add or update.
parameters.name: body

operations.summary: Add or update a user's credential on a system. This applies both to data and, if applicable, login credenitals.

operations.notes: This will delete all credentials except the default system credential. The internal users will remain unchanged and their individual credentials will fall back to the default system credential on all future interactions. Users must have ADMIN role or greater on a system to delete its roles. No sensitive information will be returned.

parameters.description: The id of the system.
parameters.name: systemId

operations.summary: Deletes all credentials registered to a system.

apis.description: List of internal user credentials on this system

operations.notes: Users must have ADMIN role or greater on a system to view its credentials. No sensitive information will be returned. This is strictly to keep track of which internal users have their own credentials.

parameters.description: The id of the system.
parameters.name: systemId

parameters.description: The username of a internal user on this system.
parameters.name: internalUsername

parameters.description: The max number of results.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The number of records to when returning the results. When paginating results, the page number = ceil(offset/limit)
parameters.name: offset

operations.summary: Get a list of all internal users and their credentials on this system.

operations.notes: Credentials will be valided when submitted. If the credentials are not valid, an error will be returned. The internalUsername value in the POST JSON must match the URI username value or an error message will be returned. Users must have ADMIN role or greater on a system to manage its credentials. No sensitive information will be returned. This is strictly to keep track of which internal users have their own credentials.

parameters.description: The id of the system.
parameters.name: systemId

parameters.description: The username of a internal user on this system.
parameters.name: internalUsername

parameters.description: The description of the internal user credential to add or update.
parameters.name: body

operations.summary: Add or update a user's credentials on a system.

operations.notes: This will delete all internal user credentials on this system. The internal users will remain unchanged and their individual credentials will fall back to the default system credential on all future interactions. Users must have ADMIN role or greater on a system to delete its roles. No sensitive information will be returned.

parameters.description: The id of the system.
parameters.name: systemId

parameters.description: The username of a internal user on this system.
parameters.name: internalUsername

operations.summary: Deletes all credentials registered to a system.

apis.description: List of internal user credentials on this system

operations.notes: If the internal user has no personal credential registered, the system default credential of the specified type will be returned. Users must have ADMIN role or greater on a system to view its credentials. No sensitive information will be returned. This is strictly to keep track of which internal users have their own credentials.

parameters.description: The id of the system.
parameters.name: systemId

parameters.description: The username of a internal user on this system.
parameters.name: internalUsername

parameters.description: The configuration type to which to apply this credential.
parameters.name: credentialType

parameters.description: The max number of results.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The number of records to when returning the results. When paginating results, the page number = ceil(offset/limit)
parameters.name: offset

operations.summary: Get the internal user credential of the given type on the system.

operations.notes: Credentials will be valided when submitted. If the credentials are not valid, an error will be returned. The internalUsername value in the POST JSON must match the URI username value or an error message will be returned. Users must have ADMIN role or greater on a system to manage its credentials. No sensitive information will be returned. This is strictly to keep track of which internal users have their own credentials.

parameters.description: The id of the system.
parameters.name: systemId

parameters.description: The username of a internal user on this system.
parameters.name: internalUsername

parameters.description: The configuration type to which to apply this credential.
parameters.name: credentialType

parameters.description: The description of the internal user credential to add or update.
parameters.name: body

operations.summary: Add or update a credential of the given type on a system.

operations.notes: This will delete all internal user credentials for the specified type on this system. The internal users will remain unchanged and their individual credentials will fall back to the default system credential on all future interactions. Users must have ADMIN role or greater on a system to delete its roles. No sensitive information will be returned.

parameters.description: The id of the system.
parameters.name: systemId

parameters.description: The username of a internal user on this system.
parameters.name: internalUsername

parameters.description: The configuration type to which to apply this credential.
parameters.name: credentialType

operations.summary: Deletes the internal user credentials for the given credential type on a system.

customDirectives.description: Any custom directives that should be appended to scheduler directives. ex. #$ -A TG-12345
customDirectives.name: customDirectives

default.description: Is this the default queue for the system.
default.name: default

maxJobs.description: The maximum number of jobs that can be in queue at once.
maxJobs.name: maxJobs

maxMemoryPerNode.description: The max memory available per node to jobs submitted to this queue.
maxMemoryPerNode.name: maxMemoryPerNode

maxNodes.description: The max nodes available per node to jobs submitted to this queue.
maxNodes.name: maxNodes

maxProcessorsPerNode.description: The max processors per node available to jobs submitted to this queue.
maxProcessorsPerNode.name: maxProcessorsPerNode

maxRequestedTime.description: The max length of jobs submitted to this queue in hhh:mm:ss format.
maxRequestedTime.name: maxRequestedTime

maxUserJobs.description: The maximum number of jobs per user that can be in queue at once.
maxUserJobs.name: maxUserJobs

name.description: The name of the batch queue.
name.name: name

executionType.description: The execution paradigm used to run jobs on this system.
executionType.name: executionType

login.description: The login config defining how to connect to this system for job submission.
login.name: login

maxSystemJobs.description: The maximum number of jobs that can be simultaneously run on the system across all queues.
maxSystemJobs.name: maxSystemJobs

maxSystemJobsPerUser.description: The maximum number of jobs that can be simultaneously run on the system across all queues by a single user.
maxSystemJobsPerUser.name: maxSystemJobsPerUser

queues.description: The execution paradigm used to run jobs on this system.
queues.name: queues

scheduler.description: The type of scheduled used to run jobs.
scheduler.name: scheduler

scratchDir.description: The scratch directory where job execution directories will be created at runtime. The workDir is used if this is not specified.
scratchDir.name: scratchDir

workDir.description: The work directory where job execution directories will be created at runtime. This is used if scratchDir is not specified. If neither are specified, the job directory will be created in the system homeDir.
workDir.name: workDir

auth.description: The default authentication credential used for this system.
auth.name: auth

host.description: The hostname or ip address of the submission server
host.name: host

port.description: The port number of the submission server.
port.name: port

protocol.description: The protocol used to authenticate to the submission server.
protocol.name: protocol

result.description: All matching roles for this system
result.name: result

result.description: The user's role for this system
result.name: result

auth.description: The default authentication credential used for this system.
auth.name: auth

homeDir.description: The path on the remote system to use as the home directory for all API requests. For cases where the home directory should be dynamically defined, the ${USERNAME} token can be included in the homeDir value to represent the username of the authenticated user. ex. /home/${USERNAME}.
homeDir.name: homeDir

host.description: The hostname or ip address of the storage server
host.name: host

mirror.description: Whether the permissions set on the server should be pushed to the storage system itself. This only applies to IRODS and AWS systems.
mirror.name: mirror

port.description: The port number of the storage server.
port.name: port

protocol.description: The protocol used to authenticate to the storage server.
protocol.name: protocol

publicAppsDir.description: The path on the remote system where apps will be stored if this is set as the default public storage system.
publicAppsDir.name: publicAppsDir

resource.description: The name of the target resource when defining an IRODS system.
resource.name: resource

rootDir.description: The path on the remote system to use as the root for all API requests.
rootDir.name: rootDir

zone.description: The name of the zone when defining an IRODS system.
zone.name: zone

credential.description: The credential used to authenticate to the remote system. Depending on the authentication protocol of the remote system, this could be an OAuth Token, X.509 certificate, Kerberose token, or an private key..
credential.name: credential

default.description: Is this the default credential for this internal user of this type on this system?
default.name: default

expirationDate.description: The date the credential expires in ISO 8601 format.
expirationDate.name: expirationDate

internalUsername.description: The username of the internal user associated with this credential.
internalUsername.name: internalUsername

parentType.description: The system type this credential is associated with.
parentType.name: parentType

password.description: The password on the remote system used to authenticate.
password.name: password

privateKey.description: The public ssh key used to authenticate to the remote system..
privateKey.name: privateKey

publicKey.description: The public ssh key used to authenticate to the remote system.
publicKey.name: publicKey

server.description: The server from which a credential may be obtained.
server.name: server

username.description: The local username on the remote system used to authenticate.
username.name: username

valid.description: Is the credential still valid or has it expired?.
valid.name: valid

default.description: Is the system the default for the authenticated user?
default.name: default

environment.description: Environment variables to set upon login prior to job submission.
environment.name: environment

executionType.description: The execution paradigm used to run jobs on this system.
executionType.name: executionType

lastModified.description: The date this system was last modified in ISO 8601 format.
lastModified.name: lastModified

login.description: The login config defining how to connect to this system for job submission.
login.name: login

maxSystemJobs.description: The maximum number of jobs that can be simultaneously run on the system across all queues.
maxSystemJobs.name: maxSystemJobs

maxSystemJobsPerUser.description: The maximum number of jobs that can be simultaneously run on the system across all queues by a single user.
maxSystemJobsPerUser.name: maxSystemJobsPerUser

queues.description: The execution paradigm used to run jobs on this system.
queues.name: queues

revision.description: The number of times this app has been updated.
revision.name: revision

scheduler.description: The type of scheduled used to run jobs.
scheduler.name: scheduler

scratchDir.description: The scratch directory where job execution directories will be created at runtime. The workDir is used if this is not specified.
scratchDir.name: scratchDir

site.description: The site associated with this system.
site.name: site

startupScript.name: startupScript

status.description: The status of this system. Systems must be in UP status to be used.
status.name: status

storage.description: The storage config defining how to connect to this system for data staging.
storage.name: storage

workDir.description: The work directory where job execution directories will be created at runtime. This is used if scratchDir is not specified. If neither are specified, the job directory will be created in the system homeDir.
